Data type routinesÂ¶

can_cast(from_,Â to[,Â casting])

Returns True if cast between data types can occur according to the casting rule.

promote_types(type1,Â type2)

Returns the data type with the smallest size and smallest scalar kind to which both type1 and type2 may be safely cast.

min_scalar_type(a)

For scalar a, returns the data type with the smallest size and smallest scalar kind which can hold its value.

result_type(*arrays_and_dtypes)

Returns the type that results from applying the NumPy type promotion rules to the arguments.

common_type(\*arrays)

Return a scalar type which is common to the input arrays.

obj2sctype(rep[,Â default])

Return the scalar dtype or NumPy equivalent of Python type of an object.

Creating data typesÂ¶

dtype(obj[,Â align,Â copy])

Create a data type object.

format_parser(formats,Â names,Â titles[,Â â€¦])

Class to convert formats, names, titles description to a dtype.

Data type informationÂ¶

finfo(dtype)

Machine limits for floating point types.

iinfo(type)

Machine limits for integer types.

MachAr([float_conv,Â int_conv,Â â€¦])

Diagnosing machine parameters.

Data type testingÂ¶

issctype(rep)

Determines whether the given object represents a scalar data-type.

issubdtype(arg1,Â arg2)

Returns True if first argument is a typecode lower/equal in type hierarchy.

issubsctype(arg1,Â arg2)

Determine if the first argument is a subclass of the second argument.

issubclass_(arg1,Â arg2)

Determine if a class is a subclass of a second class.

find_common_type(array_types,Â scalar_types)

Determine common type following standard coercion rules.

MiscellaneousÂ¶

typename(char)

Return a description for the given data type code.

sctype2char(sctype)

Return the string representation of a scalar dtype.

mintypecode(typechars[,Â typeset,Â default])

Return the character for the minimum-size type to which given types can be safely cast.

maximum_sctype(t)

Return the scalar type of highest precision of the same kind as the input.
